Message.Title: Renesas drives eight-core 'big-little' into automotive
Message.Msg: PARIS - Renesas Electronics and its subsidiary Renesas Mobile Corp. have announced the addition of the R-Car H2 system-chip to the R-Car Series of automotive SoCs. With four Cortex-A15 and four Cortex-A7 processor cores it is intended to provide higher CPU performance for the automotive infotainment market. The processor cores are licensed from ARM Holdings plc (Cambridge, England) while Renesas has selected the 'Rogue' PowerVR G6400 GPU from Imagination Technologies Group plc (Kings Langley, England) for the 3-D graphics rendering. The complex chip includes media hardware accelerators to execute the display content improvements necessary for human-machine interface, navigation data and Movie/DVD handling. System block diagram Click on image to enlarge The R-Car H2 includes PowerVR Series6 G6400 GPU to support open technologies like OpenGL ES 2.0, but also the OpenGL ES 3.0 and OpenCL standards. Renesas noted that the bus architecture has dedicated CPU and IP caches to reduce the DDR3 memory bandwidth consumption. In order to ensure adequate memory bandwidth, the R-Car H2 is equipped with two independent DDR3-1600 32-bit interfaces. Renesas said the R-Car H2 chip is available now. PARIS - Renesas Electronics and its subsidiary Renesas Mobile Corp. have announced the addition of the R-Car H2 system-chip to the R-Car Series of automotive SoCs. With four Cortex-A15 and four Cortex-A7 processor cores it is intended to provide higher CPU performance for the automotive infotainment market. The processor cores are licensed from ARM Holdings plc (Cambridge, England) while Renesas has selected the 'Rogue' PowerVR G6400 GPU from Imagination Technologies Group plc (Kings Langley, England) for the 3-D graphics rendering. The complex chip includes media hardware accelerators to execute the display content improvements necessary for human-machine interface, navigation data and Movie/DVD handling. Message.Title: The Final Hour
Message.Msg: I've tried to post for the last two days but for some reason my posts have been deleted. Since I don't care that much about it, I'm not going to fight with the message board police if this, too, doesn't get posted. The whining the last few days is simply absurd. There has been NO volume, other than in the Final Hour, and that's the ONLY part of the day that really "matters", especially to the pros. Both of the last 2 days had low volume that was added to rather dramatically in the last hour, and on Monday it was the last 10 minutes. On both days the surge in volume was to the UPSIDE and the stock closed well off its lows, or as in yesterday, virtually at its highs. But, all the moaning and griping about the volume and price movement is so childish as to almost keep me from being involved on here at all. To make a big deal about the stock going down 10, 15, 20cents on LOW volume is RIDICULOUS! ( And, BTW...if people weren't so myopic about THIS stock, they would have seen the SAME kind of LOW volume in BRCM, QCOM, AMD, AAPL and many others, yesterday.) And, for whomever said: "I don't see anything good about the stock being held down so the company can buy back mores shares"....well, are you kidding me??? REALLY? If, somehow, GS, JPM or whomever IS somehow holding down the stock so the company can buy 10s of millions of shares at THIS PRICE, that would be GRREAT! For both the company AND the shareholders. I saw yesterday's pop building RIGHT at 3PM. From then until 3:20, the stock added 1mm shares and moved up almost 1/2%. In the final ten minutes another 1mm shares were bought and there were some BIG blocks ALL trading on upticks. This is GOOD action, and nothing that happens BEFORE 3PM MATTERS, AT all (barring some actual news announcement pertaining to the company or the worldwide economy). So, one last time...it's NOT how the stock STARTS the day, it's how it FINISHES...i.e. The Final Hour. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max
Anybody can bolt together some ARM cores and GPU cores these days. Does anybody expect to make a buck?

Hi kvimax1, glad to have you back, as I always appreciate your posts. I've probably been guilty of some whining lately, but that's only because I'm a long-time long that's growing a tad frustrated waiting for the breakout and end to NVDA's bear market. We both know this stock should be in the $20s by now, given the huge markets that the company is beginning to penetrate. So it's a little painful to see us still languishing near $12.50... Anyway, I hope that a serious breakout is soon upon us, and hope that you're well.
I think NVDA is about to initiate a new direction.

I agree, Ibexx. The refusal of the stock to really break down and the last two day's final hours being so positive, and even seeing it up for a few minutes, today, with the market getting hit, sure seems like we're on the cusp of a new trend. I'd surely like to see the volume expand some more, and IF the market doesn't get really hammered, here, I think we will see the stock up, today. While it might take until June, as you mentioned, recently, I have a feeling it might happen sooner. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max
Hang in there Max. Your contributions are very much appreciated. Just turn up the filters to dim the noise -- very much a coping technique for these boards.

The rewards will come to those of us with long term horizon. Personally, yeah I would like to see the stock move up but to me the long term plan is more important. Jensen obviously feels the same way sacrificing a short term gain in T4 for the longer term wins withT4 lte. Jensen was a former employee of AMD as we all know; know he can afford to buy AMD. I put my money on him. He’s battling giants and is clawing his way to the top.

Topic.Title: Project Shield's unannounced details...when would they be released?

Message.Msg: mv_mngr, It's still premature to come up with an estimated BOM right now, as some specs bearing material effect on BOM are still un-announced; namely, battery size, storage, display and build materials etc. Going out on a limb (just for the fun of it) I would say that the final number of Project Shield's BOM may hover around $200, plus/minus 10%.

Message.Title: AMD Sky(Fall)
Message.Msg: Wednesday, March 27, 2:29 PM ET AMD (AMD) counters Nvidia's (NVDA) GRID server-based graphics platform by launching Sky, a server graphics card line that also enables remote access to GPU resources for gaming. Unlike Nvidia, AMD isn't offering its own servers (it's leaving that to OEMs) and hasn't yet discussed enterprise applications. SemiAccurate likes AMD's aggressive pricing for Sky.

Instant validation of Grid. (Poor AMD, those guys never seem to have an original idea, they always prefer playing someone else's game by someone else's rules. How much thinner can they spread themselves?)

I doubt AMD's implementation will be anything but half-baked and too late. Nvidia's got the right hardware, the right software, the right sales folks, and the drive to get this to market. AMD will end up here just as it is in HPC/workstation cards - a nobody.
How many resources does AMD have to go around... ?? literally, AMD gonna watch the sky fall...

Message.Title: Jensen On Project Shield
Message.Msg: March 19th Investor Presentaion. "I have no expectation on Project Shield and you shouldn't either." "We plan on a modest launch in US and Canada" "30 points of margin, retailers expect 30% "Selling point for high end Nvidia GPU's All Fair Statements _____________________________________ Tech Press hands on from PAC East: Incoming By End Of June "Unchanged from CES is when exactly the Shield will come out and for how much. NVIDIA insists it's still on track for launch in late Q2 (by the end of June) and have already decided internally how much to price it. When pressed on whether we'll see the Shield sell for under $500, NVIDIA senior PR manager Bryan Del Rizzo refused to budge. Maybe we'll hear more at E3 in June? We'd better, because by then, there will be even more gaming hardware available or worth waiting for. The Ouya, Razer Edge Pro, GameStick, PS4, next-gen Xbox and "Steam Box" will all be vying for our dollars. If the Shield isn't priced aggressively, it won't stand a chance." dviceDOTcom/2013-3-26/hands-project-shield-nvidias-biggest-gaming-gamble-yet ______________________________________________________________ BOM Cost - Mega Volume much lower....small initial launch much higher. Still no reports in Digitimes about who is making the Project Shield for Nvidia.

Topic.Title: Indie games push industry's future away from consoles

Message.Msg: I appreciate the growth of mobile games industry, but I wonder how much popularity growth it has left. The quality of games is an issue. Also, it can be hard to make a buck as every developer is getting crowded out from the 10s of thousands of other developers all trying to sell their game for $10...oops I mean $5....oops I mean $2....ah the heck of it just make it free and try to add some in game purchases to make any money. Also, given there is no proper direction pad and button layout and relies too much on touch screen interaction, it is hard to put out popular action games that involve precise movements and aiming. Given that these are the best sellers on console, that is an issue. In any case, I wish all game developers luck since I gaming is a favorite hobby of mine, and I'd like to see all areas continue to innovate and thrive, from PC to console to mobile.

Message.Title: One technical websites says this about NVDA....make sure to count the number of stars
Message.Msg: ""Price and moving averages has closed above its Short term moving average. Short term moving average is currently above mid-term; AND above long term moving averages. From the relationship between price and moving averages; we can see that: This stock is BULLISH in short-term; and BULLISH in mid-long term. Bollinger Bands"" ""NVDA has closed below upper band by 43.7%. Bollinger Bands are 47.5% narrower than normal. The narrow width of the bands suggests low volatility as compared to NVDA's normal range. The bands have been in this narrow range for 8 bars. This is a sign that the market may be about to initiate a new trend."" stoxlineDOTcom/quote.php?symbol=nvda Another bullish sign is that a certain swing trader had just sold the stock or wrote covered calls on it. This guy has been the best contrarian indicator on this board....with an uncanny sense of timing: always selling out at the low. lol
